# Draft:World of Warcraft: Midnight

----
World of Warcraft: Midnight is the eleventh expansion for World of Warcraft, developed by Blizzard Entertainment. It was announced at BlizzCon 2023 as the second installment in the Worldsoul Saga storyline, following The War Within. Blizzard has stated that the expansion will be released in 2026.
Gameplay
Player Housing
Midnight introduces player housing, a long-requested feature within the community. According to Polygon, the system provides customization tools such as grid-based placement, rotation, resizing, recoloring, and advanced controls for precise arrangements.
Prey System
The expansion also introduces the “Prey” system, a new form of open-world challenge content. PC Gamer describes it as an activity where players select a difficulty—Normal, Hard, or Nightmare—then track and confront a target that can also counter-attack during encounters. Higher difficulties introduce multiple phases and culminate in one-on-one boss battles, with rewards including mounts, cosmetic items, and housing decorations
Setting and Content
Midnight returns players to Quel’Thalas, revisiting areas such as Silvermoon City and Eversong Woods while introducing new regions like the Voidstorm. Blizzard also confirmed a roadmap that includes new dungeons, raids, and instanced activities called “Delves”
Release Date of World of Warcraft: Midnight
Blizzard Entertainment officially states that World of Warcraft: Midnight will be released on or before June 30, 2026
Additionally, Windows Central characterizes Midnight as being scheduled for release in 2026, noting that The War Within debuted in August 2024, making a mid-2026 launch plausible Windows Central.
